searchDocs.title: MDX Blog Post
searchDocs.content: Blog posts support Docusaurus Markdown features, such as MDX. tip Use the power of React to create interactive blog posts. <button onClick={() => alert('button clicked!')}>Click me!</button> Click me!

searchDocs.title: Welcome
searchDocs.content: Docusaurus blogging features are powered by the blog plugin. Simply add Markdown files (or folders) to the blog directory. Regular blog authors can be added to authors.yml. The blog post date can be extracted from filenames, such as: 2019-05-30-welcome.md2019-05-30-welcome/index.md A blog post folder can be convenient to co-locate blog post images: The blog supports tags as well! And if you don't want a blog: just delete this directory, and use blog: false in your Docusaurus config.

searchDocs.title: License​
searchDocs.content: A license gives you lifetime access to premium Vault Explorer features.  Purchasing a license is also a way to support the development of the plugin.  There are 2 types of licenses: Basic and Extended

searchDocs.title: Basic License​
searchDocs.content: The basic license can be used on up to 2 devices.

searchDocs.title: Extended License​
searchDocs.content: The extended license can be up on up to 5 devices.  Buy a license

searchDocs.title: Register your device​
searchDocs.content: In Obsidian, open SettingsClick Vault ExplorerUnder the Premium section, enter your license key received by emailCongratulations. Your device is now registered to that license

searchDocs.title: Unregister your device​
searchDocs.content: In Obsidian, open SettingsClick Vault ExplorerUnder the Premium section, click the Unregister device button

searchDocs.title: List
searchDocs.content: List

searchDocs.title: Installation​
searchDocs.content: If you haven't done so already, install the Vault Explorer plugin from the community plugin store.

searchDocs.title: Open the explorer view​
searchDocs.content: Open the explorer view by clicking on the compass icon in the left-hand sidebar.  You may also run Open vault explorer view from the command palette.

searchDocs.title: Change views​
searchDocs.content: Views are different visual formats for displaying your vault files. When you first open the explorer view, the Grid view is active.  To change to another view, click one of the view tabs.  To reorder the tabs, drag one tab and drop it onto another tab.

searchDocs.title: Filter by favorites​
searchDocs.content: Filters allow you to control what is displayed in a view.  One of the basic filters is the favorite filter. The favorite filter allows you to only display notes that contain a favorite property with a value of true.  You must set a property before using the favorite filter  Open the plugin settings by clicking the gear icon in the upper right hand cornerUnder the Built-in Properties section, find the Favorite property settingClick the dropdown and select a property  If no properties are listed, please add a checkbox property to one of your notes. This property will then appear in the dropdown list.  Now go to back to the explorer view, and click the favorites checkbox. The view will now only display notes that have the favorite property.  info The favorite filter is applied on top of other filters such as the timestamp filter or the custom filter.

searchDocs.title: Create a custom filter group​
searchDocs.content: The custom filter gives you granular control over what should displayed in a view. The custom filter is organized into filter groups and filter rules. A filter group can have many filter rules.  Let's start by creating a filter group.  Click the custom filter button. It has 3 vertical dotsClick the create filter group button. It has a plus icon  Now that you have a filter group, let's add a filter rule.  Click the add filter rule button. It has a plus iconNext, click the property type dropdown. Change it from text to listThen, click the property dropdown. Change it from Select a property to tagsThen, click the condition dropdown and change it from contains to exists  Finally, let's enable our filter group  Click outside of the modal to go back to the explorer viewClick the filter group to enable it  With the filter group enabled, you will only see notes that have a tags property in their frontmatter.  info You may only have one filter group enabled at a time

searchDocs.title: Congratulations​
searchDocs.content: Congratulations! You have just learned the basics of using the Vault Explorer plugin.

searchDocs.title: What's next?​
searchDocs.content: Learn more about custom filter rulesLearn about Premium
